name: Idris Elba
description:
'''Idrissa Akuna Elba''' [[Order of the British Empire|OBE]] ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|ɪ|d|r|ᵻ|s}} {{respell|IH|driss}}; born 6 September 1972) is an English actor and rapper. He has received a [[Golden Globe Award]] as well as nominations for three [[BAFTA Awards]] and six [[Primetime Emmy Awards|Emmy Awards]]. He was named in the [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] list of the Most Influential People in the World in 2016. His films have grossed over {{US$|9.8 billion|long=no}} at the global box office, making him one of the top 20 highest-grossing actors. In 2025, Elba was named as the UK's third-most influential black person in the [[Powerlist|2026 Powerlist]].

Elba studied acting at the [[National Youth Music Theatre]] in London. He rose to prominence playing [[Stringer Bell]] in the [[HBO]] series ''[[The Wire]]'' (2002–2004), and [[Chief inspector#United Kingdom|DCI]] [[John Luther]] in the [[BBC One]] series ''[[Luther (TV series)|Luther]]'' (2010–2019), the latter of which earned him the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Miniseries or Television Film]] as well as four nominations for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie|Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Limited Series or Movie]]. He was also Emmy-nominated for his guest role in [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] comedy-drama series ''[[The Big C (TV series)|The Big C]]'' (2011) and for his leading role in [[Apple TV+]] thriller series ''[[Hijack (TV series)|Hijack]]'' (2024). He is also known for his recurring guest role as [[List of The Office (American TV series) characters#Charles Miner|Charles Miner]] in the [[NBC]] [[sitcom]] ''[[The Office (American TV series)|The Office]]'' (2009).

On film, he portrayed a ruthless and charismatic [[warlord]] in the [[Netflix]] drama ''[[Beasts of No Nation (film)|Beasts of No Nation]]'' (2015) for which he received the [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role|Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Actor in a Supporting Role]] as well as nominations for a [[BAFTA Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role|British Academy Film Award]] and [[Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actor – Motion Picture|Golden Globe Award]]. He portrayed [[Nelson Mandela]] in ''[[Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom]]'' (2013) for which he was nominated for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama]]. He has also acted in ''[[American Gangster (film)|American Gangster]]'' (2007), ''[[Obsessed (2009 film)|Obsessed]]'' (2009), ''[[Prometheus (2012 film)|Prometheus]]'' (2012), ''[[Pacific Rim (film)|Pacific Rim]]'' (2013), ''[[Star Trek Beyond]]'' (2016), ''[[Molly's Game]]'' (2017), ''[[The Dark Tower (2017 film)|The Dark Tower]]'' (2017), ''[[Hobbs & Shaw]]'' (2019), ''[[The Harder They Fall (2021 film)|The Harder They Fall]]'' (2021), and ''[[A House of Dynamite]]'' (2025).

He joined the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) portraying [[Heimdall (Marvel Cinematic Universe)|Heimdall]] in six films beginning with ''[[Thor (film)|Thor]]'' (2011), as well as the [[DC Extended Universe]] playing [[Bloodsport (character)|Bloodsport]] in [[The Suicide Squad (film)|''The Suicide Squad'']] (2021). He voiced [[Chief Bogo]] in ''[[Zootopia]]'' (2016), ''[[Zootopia+]]'' (2022) and its upcoming sequel ''[[Zootopia 2]]'' (2025). He voiced [[Shere Khan]] in ''[[The Jungle Book (2016 film)|The Jungle Book]]'', and Fluke in ''[[Finding Dory]]'' in 2016. He has voiced [[Knuckles the Echidna]] in ''[[Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (film)|Sonic the Hedgehog 2]]'' (2022), ''[[Knuckles (TV series)|Knuckles]]'' (2024), and ''[[Sonic the Hedgehog 3 (film)|Sonic the Hedgehog 3]]'' (2024). He made his directorial debut with ''[[Yardie (film)|Yardie]]'' (2018). Apart from acting, Elba performs as a DJ under the moniker '''DJ Big Driis''' or '''Idris''' and as an [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] singer. Elba is a co-owner of the [[Formula E]] team, [[Kiro Race Co]].
